turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Database.
turn.2: NewSQL is a class of modern relational databases that aims to provide the same scalable performance of NoSQL systems for online transaction processing (read-write) workloads while still using SQL and maintaining the ACID guarantees of a traditional database system.
turn.3: What are the different types of software?
turn.4: Databases are used to support internal operations of organizations and to underpin online interactions with customers and suppliers (see Enterprise software).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Databases are used to hold administrative information and more specialized data, such as engineering data or economic models.
turn.7: What are some examples of the models?
turn.8: Examples include computerized library systems, flight reservation systems, computerized parts inventory systems, and many content management systems that store websites as collections of webpages in a database.
turn.9: What are some other types of data that can be stored?
turn.10: One way to classify databases involves the type of their contents, for example: bibliographic, document-text, statistical, or multimedia objects.
turn.11: Is there another way to classify them?
turn.12: Another way is by their application area, for example: accounting, music compositions, movies, banking, manufacturing, or insurance.
